subject: Re: [junit] Experience with jdk1.4 assert keyword
msgSnippet: ... And what if the method is used only by clients that guarantee the precondition and isn t a part of the public API? Should one really program that
messageBody:
--- Paolo Perrotta <pperrotta@...> wrote:
> > Why is something like
> > assert foo != null : "Foo null";
> > a bad thing?
>
> It's not bad in itself - it's bad when I use it instead of proper
> design and
> testing to catch things that "might go wrong" at runtime. When I
> started
>

And what if the method is used only by clients that guarantee the
precondition and isn't a part of the public API? Should one really
program that defensively everywhere? I keep hearing people claim or
imply they do, yet with rare exceptions I don't see code that reflects
that level of defensiveness.

Regards,

Rob
